isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER, GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 9800 - Troubleshooting

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to Circuit Diagram Books CTS-5254, CTS-5254V or CTS-5254W in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Inspect all related connectors and wires for clean, tight connections, free of damage or corrosion.

caution.para: When testing connectors, take care not to damage pins or pin receptacles. Use proper test leads.

note.para: When checking circuits, inspect connectors for bent or broken pins, pins that have been pushed back or expanded and corroded or moist connectors. If any of these conditions exist, repair before continuing with troubleshooting procedures.

svcproc.title: SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER MODULE POWER AND GROUND CIRCUITS
svcproc.para:
Refer to Speedometer/Tachometer Module
, for operation description.

table.title: Speedometer, Odometer and Tachometer Failure Chart

entry.para: 1. Speedometer or tachometer does not work or operates inaccurately while driving.

Verify all DIP switches are in the "0" position. If not, reset all DIP switches to "0". If available, use the EZ-Tech instrument cluster software to test the speedometer and tachometer. If a loss of prgramming is suspected, and a service tool is not available, the DIP switches may be set to "1" for use with an electronic engine. The odometer switch (Number ten (10) on right bank) should be set to "0" for miles or "1" for kilometers.
Use an Electronic Service Tool (Pro-Link or EZ-Tech) to verify that the ECM is communicating on the data link and is programmed correctly.
2. Speedometer and tachometer needles do not move on power up.
Remove cluster and verify ignition voltage and ground is provided to cluster. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace cluster.
3. Speedometer or tachometer needles move erratically or incompletely on power up sweep.

Perform Self Diagnostics Test. Refer to Speedometer/ Tachometer Self Diagnostic Test
.
4. Speedometer pointer is STILL DEAD or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the speedometer and tachometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
5. Tachometer pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the tachometer and speedometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
6. Odometer does not increment properly as described in Speedometer/Tachometer Self Diagnostic Test.
Remove odometer from cluster. MOMENTARILY apply 12 volt DC power across odometer leads. If odometer increments with power applied, REPLACE the cluster.
7. Speedometer or tachometer does not work while driving.

Insure that the vehicle Data Link is not shorted or wired incorrectly. With the ignition on, voltage from Positive data link circuit to ground should be approximately 4 volts. Voltage from Negative data link circuit to ground should be approximately 1 volt. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAM MANUAL.

Check speedometer and tachometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAM MANUAL and to Testing Vehicle Speed Signal to ECM and data link circuits between the Speedometer/ Tachometer module to the ECM
.
Verify data from the ECM by using an electronic service tool (EST), such as the EZ-Tech or Pro-Link 9000, with the applicable engine software. If data is present replace cluster.
